title: HIV Needle Stick Risk Assessment Stratification Protocol (RASP)
desc: The HIV Needle Stick Risk Assessment Stratification Protocol (RASP) Quantifies HIV exposure risk by source and exposure type and need for prophylaxis.

orgreference.text: Vertesi L. Risk Assessment Stratification Protocol (RASP) to help patients decide on the use of postexposure prophylaxis for HIV exposure. CJEM. 2003 Jan;5(1):46-8.

data.evidence:
Basic risk = 1 / (Source population x Inoculum type x Method of transmission)

Total risk = Basic risk x Volume of inoculum

*Acute AIDS illness defined as “end stage AIDS, hospitalized, high viral load”. Unknown HIV status, high-risk situation defined as “suspected HIV, IV drug user, unknown needle with high local HIV prevalence”.
